As I see it, I never "invested" in Bitcoin.  Rather, I hold my savings in Bitcoin.

Savings are useful for deferring a consumption or investment decision. The better the savings vehicle, the longer you can defer a decision, the better your decision will be.   Bitcoin incentivizes you to hold for a few years, fiat incentivizes you to hold for a few months.

Bitcoin is easily the most scalable network *where anyone can cheaply validate*. You cannot contest it either, because Bitcoin transactions are as small as they can be. We can only increase their economic density per byte by bundling tx offchain and settling them occasionally.
